snippet: The White House said that information about major Internet security flaws should be shared with computer and software manufacturers so they can be fixed. But it left broad exceptions for cases that involve national security.
abstract: White House officials say Pres Obama has decided that National Security Agency should reveal most major flaws it discovers in Internet security, but a loophole exists that could allow NSA to exploit security flaws both to crack encryption on the Internet and to design cyberweapons.
lead_paragraph: The White House said that information about major Internet security flaws should be shared with computer and software manufacturers so they can be fixed. But it left broad exceptions for cases that involve national security.

headline.main: Obama Lets N.S.A. Exploit Some Internet Flaws, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Obama Lets N.S.A. Exploit Some Internet Flaws, Officials Say

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
